standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
###Place Value  We can think in terms of tenths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}0.9 - 0.8\\\\ &=9\text{ tenths} - 8\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=1\text{ tenth}\\\\ &=0.1 \end{align}$
###Place Value Grids  We can use tenths grids:  $\blueE{0.9}  =$ [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{0.8} =$  [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{0.9} - \maroonD{0.8} = $ [[☃ image 3]]  $\blueE{0.9} - \maroonD{0.8} = 0.1$

images.alt: A square divided into 10 equally-sized columns to show tenths. 9 columns are shaded and 1 column is not shaded.
A square divided into 10 equally-sized columns to show tenths. 8 columns are shaded and 2 columns are not shaded.
A square divided into 10 equally-sized columns to show tenths. 9 columns are shaded. 8 of the shaded columns are crossed out. The other 1 column is unshaded.
